fields.headline: We don't like ...
fields.bodyText: Did you buy something with your credit card this week, or did someone steal your identity and go an a shopping spree in your absence? Identity fraud is now one of Britain's fastest growing crimes, costing the British economy over £1.3bn a year. While banks are reporting record profits many critics are asking if they are doing enough to protect their customers. Most banks appear to think the answer is to sell expensive "protection insurance" rather than bring in effective security measures. Chip and Pin has gone some way, but fraudsters are still operating profitably. Criminals can "phish" for a victim's details, through email, bogus websites, or via telephone. What are the banks doing to protect their customers?
